Deciphering Biological Networks with Patterned Heterogeneous Measurements.

name: SelectBoost

metadata.abstract: © 2020 The Author(s) 2020. Published by Oxford University Press.Motivation: With the growth of big data, variable selection has become one of the critical challenges in statistics. Although many methods have been proposed in the literature, their performance in terms of recall (sensitivity) and precision (predictive positive value) is limited in a context where the number of variables by far exceeds the number of observations or in a highly correlated setting. Results: In this article, we propose a general algorithm, which improves the precision of any existing variable selection method. This algorithm is based on highly intensive simulations and takes into account the correlation structure of the data. Our algorithm can either produce a confidence index for variable selection or be used in an experimental design planning perspective. We demonstrate the performance of our algorithm on both simulated and real data. We then apply it in two different ways to improve biological network reverse-engineering.
metadata.title: SelectBoost: A general algorithm to enhance the performance of variable selection methods
